definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: And did you know Feifei that it's also a verb – to mansplain?
sentences.chinese: 菲菲，你知道“男人说教”也是一个动词吗？

sentences.english: Our approach is educational and wholly voluntary.
sentences.chinese: 我们的方法是说教式的完全自愿的。

sentences.english: It was just a little too preachy-sounding, Mr. Vitrano says.
sentences.chinese: 维特拉诺说，听上去有点儿像是在说教。

sentences.english: I do not preach and I do not judge.
sentences.chinese: 我不会说教也不做评判。

sentences.english: When the fox preaches, then take care of your geese.
sentences.chinese: 每当狐狸说教，当心鹅群被盗。
他的说教听起来很空洞。

sentences.english: I don’t want to bore you with a fashion lecture
sentences.chinese: 只是，我可不想成为一个教你怎么做潮人的说教者。

sentences.english: Nagging serves no useful purpose for preventing puppy love.
sentences.chinese: 没完没了的说教对于防止孩子们早恋毫无用处。

sentences.english: Everytime he gets drunk, he goes into his lousy preaching routine.
sentences.chinese: 每次喝醉，他就开始他那令人讨厌的说教。

sentences.english: The author moralizes excessively in this work.
sentences.chinese: 作者在这部作品中说教过多。

sentences.english: Still, Mr Wang says, he understands the risk of being too preachy.
sentences.chinese: 不过，王健林表示，他知道说教性过强会有风险。

sentences.english: However it should avoid being didactic .
sentences.chinese: 不过这必须避免说教的方式。

sentences.english: Everytime he gets drunk,he goes into lousy preaching routine.
sentences.chinese: 每次喝醉，他就开始他那令人讨厌的说教。

sentences.english: Now they can get twice the money and half the moralizing in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他们听一半中国的说教，拿两倍的钱。

definition: present the facts and reason things out
pinyin: bai3 shi4 shi2 jiang3 dao4 li3

definition: earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to give sincere advice (idiom)/to exhort earnestly
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
